entry.title: Police Log: January 26, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg Police handled a range of incidents Jan. 26, including multiple warrant arrests, probation and parole violations, DUII investigations, prohibited camping and burning cases, a stalking order violation, and several non-injury traffic crashes across the city.

entry.title: Read and sip: A look behind the shelves of While Away Books
entry.summary: For Josh Jones, a day spent managing While Away Books doesn't feel like work. Instead, it's a chance to meet new people, see rare finds and share his passions with others.

entry.title: January 27, 2026
entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: CHRIS DUDLEY ANNOUNCES RUN FOR GOVERNOR
entry.summary: January 27, 2026 6:00 a.m. Chris Dudley announced his candidacy for Oregon Governor on Monday. The former Portland Trail Blazer is making his second run for the office. In 2010, Dudley came within one percentage point of beating Democrat John Kitzhaber for governor. Losing by only 22,000 votes, it was the closest gubernatorial race in...

entry.title: DC Celtic Society hosts Burns Night Dinner
entry.summary: MELROSE — Melrose Vineyards was alive with the sounds from a fiddle, bagpipes, poems by Robert Burns read out loud and people socializing over wine and food Saturday night.

entry.title: AUMSVILLE MAN JAILED FOLLOWING DUII CRASH ON SATURDAY
entry.summary: January 27, 2026 3:50 a.m. An Aumsville man was jailed following a DUII crash on Saturday. An Oregon State Police report released on Monday said shortly after 1:00 p.m. a trooper responded to the wreck on Interstate 5 southbound, approximately a mile north of Curtin. The 63-year-old driver of a sports car showed signs of...

entry.title: UMPQUA FISHERY ENHANCEMENT DERBY BEGINS WEDNESDAY
entry.summary: January 27, 2026 3:40 a.m. The Umpqua Fishery Enhancement Derby begins on Wednesday. The title sponsor for the 34th annual event is the Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians. Events include Student Day in the Rock Creek watershed on Wednesday, Kids Day at Cooper Creek Reservoir on Thursday and the Catch and Release...

entry.title: SPORTSMEN AND OUTDOOR RECREATION SHOW COMING NEXT WEEK
entry.summary: January 27, 2026 3:30 a.m. The Seven Feathers Sportsmen’s and Outdoor Recreation Show is taking place next week, February 6th through 8th at the Douglas County Fairgrounds. The 2026 featured attractions include the live “Wild Eagle Encounter presentations. The new “Nature’s Provisions” highlights crafters of locally picked, processed, and packaged edibles from land and sea....

entry.title: CHI MERCY HEALTH/CENTENNIAL HOST THIRD ANNUAL HEART HEALTH FAIR
entry.summary: January 27, 2026 3:20 a.m. As part of National Heart Health Month in February, CHI Mercy Health and Centennial Shaw Heart and Vascular Specialists will hold their third annual Heart Health Fair on Friday, February 6th. A Mercy release said residents should prepare to ignite their journey to a stronger, more vibrant heart at this...

entry.title: 14TH ANNUAL FOUR CHAPLAINS SERVICE HAPPENING FEBRUARY 7TH
entry.summary: January 27, 2026 3:05 a.m. The 14th annual Four Chaplains Service is happening on Saturday, February 7th at Westside Christian Church on West Harvard Avenue in Roseburg. The story of the Four Chaplains is a story of sacrifice, courage and love for others that organizers say must be told to every generation of Americans. Since...

entry.title: SWEENEY TODD OPENS THIS THURSDAY AT UACT
entry.summary: January 27, 2026 2:50 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: Umpqua Actors Community Theatre presents “Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street”, opening on Thursday night. Most dates are already sold out but some tickets remain for performances on Thursday nights and on Valentine’s evening. The production runs Thursday through Saturday nights at 7:00...

entry.title: Seven Feathers Douglas County Sportsmen’s & Outdoor Recreation Show Comes to Roseburg February 6–8, 2026
entry.summary: The Seven Feathers Douglas County Sportsmen’s & Outdoor Recreation Show returns to Roseburg February 6–8, 2026, at the Douglas County Fairgrounds, featuring hundreds of exhibits, family-friendly activities, outdoor gear, seminars, and special attractions for all ages.

entry.title: Workman Community Market Announces April 4 Opening Day for 2026 Season
entry.summary: Workman Community Market opens its 2026 season April 4 in Green with a family friendly celebration alongside the grand opening of Workman’s Bar and Smokehouse. The market will feature local vendors and weekly nonprofit spotlights throughout the season.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 01.26.26
entry.summary: State Senator David Brock Smith talks about the governor’s race, the upcoming short session of the legislature and other related topics.

entry.title: SUTHERLIN POLICE JAIL MAN FOLLOWING REPORTED SHOPLIFT INCIDENT
entry.summary: January 26, 2026 10:55 a.m. Sutherlin Police jailed a man following a reported shoplifting incident on Friday afternoon. An SPD report said just after 2:10 p.m. officers responded to the 300 block of West Central Avenue. Officers later located the suspect, 24-year-old Lance Ketchem walking in the 800 block of East Central Avenue. While taking...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOR SEVERAL WARRANTS
entry.summary: January 26, 2026 10:45 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man for several warrants early Saturday morning. An RPD report said just after 1:20 a.m. officers contacted the 45-year-old in the 900 block of Northwest Garden Valley Boulevard after they saw an unworked warrant for his arrest. An RPD report said at 7:00 p.m. the 46-year-old from Medford allegedly found an unlocked door to the business and entered it. He was reportedly inside for several hours and unplugged the security cameras. He also...

entry.summary: January 26, 2026 9:30 a.m. Roseburg Police charged a woman with telephonic harassment on Friday. An RPD report said the 70-year-old had allegedly called a business in the 1600 block of West Harvard dozens of times over multiple days and had left at least 14 voicemails, accusing the owners of various crimes. The woman left...

An RPD report said officers investigated an alleged incident that occurred on Thursday. Friday night at 9:45 p.m. officers contacted 27-year-old Jacob Hayter who admitted to being in a sexual relationship with a female and told officers...

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 1.26.26
entry.summary: Wilson’s Chapel of the Roses Manager Tyler Clark talks about their 125 years serving the community. A special open house will be held on Tuesday from 4:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. to show the community the remodeling and renovations they have made to their facility on West Harvard Avenue.

entry.title: Police Log: January 23 - January 26, 2026
entry.summary: Warrants and DUII arrests led Roseburg Police logs Jan. 23 to 26, along with a reported burglary, a park dispute involving a handgun, a reported sexual assault case, and multiple disorderly conduct and camping related incidents.

entry.title: Cheryl Donahoo, 37-year-President of Umpqua Valley Humane Society, dies at 78
entry.summary: For 37 years, Cheryl Donahoo served as President of the Umpqua Valley Humane Society (UVHS), working to provide aid and resources to pets, their owners and animals in need. Now, the era of her leadership in the organization has come…

entry.title: FRONTAL SYSTEM COULD BRING LIGHT RAIN TO THE UMPQUA VALLEY
entry.summary: January 26, 2026 3:50 a.m. A frontal system that is offshore on Monday could bring some light rain to the Umpqua Valley later this week. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that a weak upper-level trough is preventing moisture on Monday. The frontal system should...

entry.title: ROSEBURG CITY COUNCIL MEETING MONDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: January 26, 2026 3:40 a.m. The Roseburg City Council is meeting Monday night and will begin with a special meeting at 6:45 p.m. Councilors will consider appointing Daniel Prather to a vacant seat on the Planning Commission. Two seats are currently open. Prather will be interviewed and the council will decide whether to select him...

entry.title: MYRTLE CREEK LISTS PUBLIC MEETINGS FOR FEBRUARY
entry.summary: January 26, 2026 3:30 a.m. The City of Myrtle Creek has listed its public meetings for the month of February. *The City Council will meet on February 3rd and February 17th at 5:30 p.m. *The Myrtle Creek Urban Renewal Agency will meet on February 3rd immediately following the council meeting. *The Park Commission will hold...

entry.title: COUNTY PARKS IMPROVE SAFETY THROUGH CONNECTIVITY/INFRASTRUCTURE
entry.summary: January 26, 2026 3:20 a.m. The Douglas County Board of Commissioners along with County Parks Director Mark Wall are highlighting ongoing safety and service upgrades across the park system. A county release said the improvements include Wi-Fi coverage, updated life vest stations and signage and the addition of a camera system at the boat ramp...

entry.title: WILDLIFE SAFARI ANNOUNCES COMPLETION OF NEW LEMUR HOUSE
entry.summary: January 26, 2026 3:05 a.m. Wildlife Safari has announced the completion of the brand-new Lemur House, located in the parks free “Walk Thru Safari”. A Safari release said in October of 2025, the lemurs were temporarily relocated to an on-site holding area while demolition and reconstruction of their habitat began. After several months of construction,...

entry.title: SENATORS ANNOUNCE OVER $100 MILLION FOR CRITICAL COMMUNITY PROJECTS
entry.summary: January 26, 2026 2:50 a.m. On Friday, Oregon’s Senators Jeff Merkley and Ron Wyden announced they have secured over $100 million in federal investments for essential community-initiated projects in nearly every Oregon county in both Fiscal Year 2026 packages that have recently cleared Congress. Both senators hold a town hall in each Oregon county every...

entry.title: Drain's only grocery store, Ray's Food Place closing in February
entry.summary: Ray's Food Place is the only grocery in Drain and it's now set to close next month. Residents say this is a huge issue because the next closest grocery store is 16 miles away.

entry.title: COLD WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11:00 A.M. SATURDAY
entry.summary: January 24, 2026 6:20 a.m. A Cold Weather Advisory will remain in effect until 11:00 a.m. Saturday for central Douglas County. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said very cold temperatures as low as 20 degrees are expected within the valleys of Douglas County. Forecasters said prolonged exposure to very cold temperatures can...

entry.title: UCC's new hub boosts Roseburg's high-tech workforce training
entry.summary: Umpqua Community College unveiled its newly renovated Advanced Manufacturing & Forestry Hub on Wednesday with a community open house.
